snippet: After devoting vast resources in an attempt to remove Gov. Scott Walker from office, leaders struggled to find hope in what their defeat could mean for the political future, including in the presidential election.
abstract: Failed effort to recall Gov Scott Walker of Wisconsin marks a significant setback for organized labor's political clout in both symbolic and tangible ways; unions devoted vast resources to removing Walker, who had rolled back collective bargaining rights in the state; failure is likely to hurt union recruiting efforts, and provides a blueprint for other elected officials who are considering rollbacks in their own states.
lead_paragraph: After devoting vast resources in an attempt to remove Gov. Scott Walker from office, leaders struggled to find hope in what their defeat could mean for the political future, including in the presidential election.

headline.seo: Win in Wisconsin Casts Doubts on Union Power
headline.main: Unions, at Center of Wisconsin Recall Vote, Suffer a New Setback in Its Outcome
headline.print_headline: Unions, at Center of Wisconsin Recall Vote, Suffer a New Setback in Its Outcome
